page.title: 10The Library in Bookham
page.content:
Bookham has the smallest public library in Surrey (679 sq.ft.)but the highest readership in the county, with 140,268 issues per yr:11.46 borrowings for each copy in stock. Most popular choices are travel & biography.
The library, at the corner of Dorking Road and Lower Shott, serves a total population of about 20,000 in Bookham, Fetcham and Effingham.
Since the library is now too small a public campaign was mounted to persuade Surrey County Council to move it to the redundant school in the centre of Bookham.The school was built in the 1860's by the Dawnay family and given to the village in care of the Parish Church. The Council has agreed to a change of use but no date has yet been agreed for the move.
